definitions.definition: Of, related to, feeling, showing, or characterized by sympathy .
examples: John looked very upset. I gave him a sympathetic look.

subdefinitions.definition: Showing approval of or favor towards an idea or action .

definitions.definition: Attracting the liking of others. ( of a person )

subdefinitions.definition: Designed in a sensitive or appropriate way.

definitions.definition: Relating to, producing, or denoting an effect which arises through an affinity , interdependence , or mutual association.
examples: Sympathetic magic is based on imitation or correspondence.

subdefinitions.definition: A supernatural connection or power resulting from two items having the same form or some other correspondence . ( of magic )
Relating to musical tones produced by sympathetic vibration or to strings so tuned as to sound by sympathetic vibration.

definitions.definition: Relating to or denoting the part of the autonomic nervous system consisting of nerves arising from ganglia near the middle part of the spinal cord , supplying the internal organs , blood vessels , and glands , and balancing the action of the parasympathetic nerves.

main_definition: Of, related to, feeling, showing, or characterized by sympathy .
secondary_definitions: Attracting the liking of others. ( of a person )
( relational ) Relating to, producing, or denoting an effect which arises through an affinity , interdependence , or mutual association.

( neuroanatomy , neurology , relational ) Relating to or denoting the part of the autonomic nervous system consisting of nerves arising from ganglia near the middle part of the spinal cord , supplying the internal organs , blood vessels , and glands , and balancing the action of the parasympathetic nerves.
